description: Come and discover the sweet side of the Royal Docks in this fun walking tour led by local resident Momtaz Begum-Hossain which combines history with present day docks life.

factsheet.heading: About the tour and guide
paragraphs: Today not many Londoners know where the Royal Docks are but at one point in the city's history it was the most important location in the capital.

On this tour, you'll hear why, while finding out about more about three docks Victoria, Albert and King George V; how they were used then, how they're used now and how sugar and spices are part of the area's legacy.

During two-hour walking tour you'll see and experience what the Royal Docks has to offer today in this personal interpretation of the area by local resident Momtaz Begum-Hossain who lives and works in the Royal Docks.
The tour takes in architecture including London City Airport, The Tate & Lyle Sugar Refinery and the high-profile Royal Albert Dock development with some unexpected stop offs along the way.
Route: flat and wheelchair accessible. Opportunities to sit down are limited as there are very few benches and seating in the area.

Guide: Momtaz Begum-Hossain is an award-winning journalist, presenter and podcaster. She’s a rare Londoner who has lived in the North, East, South and West of the city but when she arrived at the Royal Docks she instantly found her home. Momtaz enjoys swimming in the docks and cycling around what she feels is the most spacious, open, relaxing and secret spot in London.

factsheet.heading: Golden Key Academy
paragraphs: This tour is led by a participant of Open City’s Golden Key Academy – a course training up insightful and engaging guides dedicated to explaining London and bringing its many stories to life. It is part of a wider collection of tour events created by Golden Key Academy guides for the Open House Festival celebrating their conclusion of the four month course.
Further info on the Golden Key Academy https://open-city.org.uk/golden-key-academy

factsheet.heading: ALL GOLDEN KEY ACADEMY TOURS ARE GOING AHEAD
paragraphs: THIS TOUR IS GOING AHEAD. PLEASE TURN UP OR CANCEL YOUR PLACE IF YOU CAN NO LONGER MAKE IT. (Info added 9/09/22)
